description: A 268-foot waterfall, located east of Seattle on the Snoqualmie River.
Mount Rainier National Park offers breathtaking hiking trails with stunning views of the majestic Mount Rainier.
The Discovery Park Loop Trail offers a scenic hike through Seattle's largest park, showcasing stunning views of Puget Sound, the Olympic Mountains, and diverse wildlife habitats.
The Cedar River Trail is a beautiful hike along the Cedar River, offering picturesque views of the river, surrounding forests, and opportunities for birdwatching and wildlife spotting.
Evans Creek Preserve is a natural oasis featuring a variety of hiking trails through forests, meadows, and wetlands, providing a peaceful escape and opportunities to observe local flora and fauna.
Soaring Eagle Regional Park offers a network of scenic hiking trails through lush forests and open meadows, providing a peaceful retreat and opportunities for wildlife viewing.

The Wildside Trail - De Leo Wall is a challenging hike that rewards adventurers with stunning views of the surrounding mountains and valleys, offering a thrilling outdoor experience for seasoned hikers.
Poo Poo Point is a popular hiking destination in the Issaquah Alps, offering panoramic views of the surrounding mountains and valleys, making it a favorite spot for paragliders and hikers alike.
The Cheshiahud Lake Union Loop offers a scenic waterfront walk around Lake Union, providing stunning views of the lake and city skyline, ideal for a leisurely stroll.
The Elliott Bay Trail is a picturesque waterfront path that offers stunning views of Elliott Bay and the Seattle skyline, making it a perfect spot for a relaxing walk or bike ride.

The Lake Washington Loop segment offers a scenic pathway along the shores of Lake Washington, providing beautiful views of the lake and surrounding landscape, perfect for a leisurely walk or bike ride.
The West Seattle waterfront offers stunning views of the Puget Sound and downtown Seattle, providing a picturesque setting for a leisurely stroll or bike ride along the water's edge.
David E. Brink Park in Kirkland offers stunning waterfront views of Lake Washington and the Seattle skyline, perfect for a relaxing stroll by the water.
Meydenbauer Park in Bellevue offers scenic views of Lake Washington, providing a peaceful escape for a leisurely stroll or a day of picnicking by the water.
The Foster Island Trail offers a peaceful nature walk through wetlands and forests, providing a serene escape from the city within Seattle's own Washington Park Arboretum.
It is a 19.1-acre public park located on the north shore of Lake Union at the south end of the Wallingford neighborhood.
Kayaking on Lake Union offers stunning views of Seattle's skyline, houseboats, and seaplanes, providing a memorable and picturesque experience on the water.

Alki Beach is a popular beach park in West Seattle, known for its sandy shores and stunning views of the Seattle skyline. It offers a range of activities including sunbathing, beach volleyball, and kayaking, making it a favorite spot for locals and tourists alike.
Ballard Kayak offers a variety of kayak tours and rentals, providing a unique way to explore Seattle's waterways and enjoy views of the city from the water.

Elliott Bay is a picturesque body of water in Seattle, offering stunning views of the city skyline, the Olympic Mountains, and Mount Rainier. It's a popular spot for kayaking, sailing, and enjoying waterfront dining, providing a quintessential Seattle experience.
Owen Beach in Point Defiance Park, Tacoma, offers stunning views of Puget Sound and the Olympic Mountains, perfect for picnics and beach activities.
Gig Harbor is a charming waterfront town in Pierce County, Washington, known for its picturesque harbor, waterfront dining, and stunning views of the Puget Sound and Mount Rainier.

Alki Beach is a popular beach park in West Seattle, known for its sandy shores and stunning views of the Seattle skyline. It offers a range of activities including sunbathing, beach volleyball, and kayaking, making it a favorite spot for locals and tourists alike.
The Cheshiahud Lake Union Loop offers a scenic waterfront walk around Lake Union, providing stunning views of the lake and city skyline, ideal for a leisurely stroll.

The Lake Washington Loop segment offers a scenic pathway along the shores of Lake Washington, providing beautiful views of the lake and surrounding landscape, perfect for a leisurely walk or bike ride.
The Burke-Gilman Trail is a popular 18-mile biking route in Seattle, offering scenic views and a relaxing ride from Ballard to Bothell.
The Sammamish River Trail is a popular biking trail in Seattle, running from Bothell to Redmond and offering scenic views along the Sammamish River.
Myrtle Edwards Park in Seattle offers a scenic waterfront bike trail with stunning views of Elliott Bay and the Olympic Mountains.
